pycm.album module¶

pycm.album.metadata(cmid)¶

Query the album metadata endpoint given the chartmetric id.

https://api.chartmetric.com/api/album/:id

Parameters

cmid – string chartmetric.com entity ID

Returns

dictionary of album metadata

pycm.album.playlists(cmid, start_date, end_date=None, stype='spotify', status='current', indie=False, limit=100)¶

Query the album playlist placement API endpoint.

https://api.chartmetric.com/api/album/:id/:streamingType/:status/playlists :param cmid: string chartmetric.com entity ID :param start_date: string ISO date :param end_date: string ISO date :param stype: string streaming platform ‘spotify, ‘applemusic’, or ‘deezer’ :param status: string ‘current’ or ‘past’ :param indie: Boolean true if playlist created by major labels :param limit: number of entries to be returned

https://api.chartmetric.com/api/album/:id/tunefind

Parameters

cmid – string chartmetric.com entity ID

Query the chartmetric API for artist fanmetrics.

Parameters

  • start_date – string ISO date %Y-%m-%d

  • dsrc – string data source spotify, facebook, twitter, instagram, youtube, wikipedia, bandsintown, soundcloud, facebook_fans_by_country, or facebook_storytellers_by_country

https://api.chartmetric.com/api/artist/:id/stat/:source

pycm.credentials module¶

credentials.py

Utilities for the pycm api credentials interface.

pycm.credentials.Check(filepath=None)¶

Check that the .credentials.json file is extant within the project root directory. Also sets the credentials filename statically.

It is important that this causes failure as early in the client init phase as possible.

Returns

boolean True if .credentials.json exists AND the dictionary contains a non-empty string for the “refreshtoken” string, otherwise False.

pycm.credentials.CredentialsDir¶

Set the credentials filepath (directory + filename.json)

Parameters

filepath – string filepath e.g. /home/user/.credentials.json

Returns

string filepath

pycm.credentials.DefaultCredentials(refreshtoken)¶

Set and save the a default (only refreshtoken) .credentials.json file in the project directory or in a custom credentials directory, if set.

Parameters

refreshtoken – string refreshtoken from chartmetric

Returns

None

pycm.credentials.FetchAccessToken()¶

Use the refreshtoken to fetch the access and other credentials from chartmetric.io.

Returns

Request object in dictionary form with keys: token, expires_in, refresh_token, and scope

pycm.credentials.Filename(filename='.credentials.json')¶

Return the given filename.

Parameters

filename – string filename w/extension

Returns

string given filename w/extension

pycm.credentials.Load()¶

Load the .credentials.json file from the project root directory and return the credentials dictionary.

Returns

dict w/keys: token, scope, expires_in, refreshtoken

pycm.credentials.PeriodicUpdate(TTL_seconds=3600, repeat=None)¶

Wrapper method to take a TTL variable, wait, and call UpdateCredentials. Current chartmetric api documentation (Feb-2019) indicates a credential refresh is required every 3600 seconds.

Parameters

  • TTL_seconds – integer seconds to wait between refreshes

  • repeat – integer loops to repeat; -1 = inf

Returns

None

pycm.credentials.ProjectRootDir()¶

Return path to root directory of project with trailing slash.

Returns

string path with trailing /

pycm.credentials.TTLwait(func)¶
pycm.credentials.Update()¶

Use the .credentials.json file in the project root directory to GET the token, lifetime, and scope attributes and subsequently update the .credentials.json file.

Returns

None

pycm.credentials_manager module¶

credentials_manager.py

Credential manager for pycm. Load, store (globally), and automagically update credentials given response TTL seconds.

Usage:

>>> import credential_manager as cm
>>> print(cm.token)
>>> print(cm.refreshtoken)
>>> print(cm.expires_in) # gives actual seconds to expiry as integer
>>> print(cm.scope)

Note:

expires_in global variable here IS NOT a string, as is required for the api queries; here it is the actual representative TTL count since our last refresh. Don’t forget to str(expires_in) for API use.

pycm.credentials_manager.UpdateCredentials()¶

pycm.curator module¶

pycm.curator.lists(stype, limit=100, offset=0, indie=False, social=True)¶

Query the chartmetric.io API curator endpoint.

https://api.chartmetric.io/api/curator/:streamingType/lists

Parameters

  • stype – string ‘spotify’, ‘applemusic’, or ‘deezer’

  • limit – integer number to return

  • offset – integer offset entries to be returned

  • indie – boolean True to return non-label

  • social – boolean True to return social url data

Returns

list of dictionary playlist curator data

pycm.curator.metadata(cmid, stype)¶
pycm.curator.playlists(cmid, stype)¶

pycm.playlist module¶

pycm.playlist.evolution(cmid, byType, start_date, end_date)¶

Query the chartmetric.io API playlist/evolution endpoint

Parameters

  • cmid – string chartmetric {byType} ID

  • byType – string ‘artist’, ‘track’, ‘album’

  • start_date – string ISO beginning date %Y-%m-%d

  • end_date – string ISO ending date %Y-%m-%d

Returns

list

pycm.playlist.lists(stype='spotify', sort='followers', country='US', limit=100, offset=0, indie=False, daysAgo=7)¶

NOTE

Documentation for this endpoint is wrong. The exact given exemplar returns a 400 BAD_REQUEST -> need to strategize how to fix in the short run.

Query the chartmetri.io API playlist charts endpoint

https://api.chartmetric.io/api/playlist/:streamingType/lists

Parameters

  • stype – string ‘spotify’, ‘applemusic’, or ‘deezer’

  • sort – string ‘followers’or ‘last_updated’

  • country – string country code

  • limit – integer limit number of queries

  • offset – offset of entries to be returned

  • indie – boolean True to return indie playlists

  • daysAgo – integer how many days ago (?? -> docs are …)

Returns

dict?

Parameters

name – string process name

Returns

list of items matching process ‘name’

pycm.utilities.RequestData(urlhandle, params)¶

Build chartmetric data object and call requests.get with constructed data.

Parameters

  • urlhandle – string additional url after base with a leading and without ending slash

  • params – dictionary of keyword data to send in the query string, specific to the particular api endpoint

Returns

dictionary with keys url, headers, and params

pycm.utilities.RequestGet(data)¶

Method to call requests.get with data.

Parameters

data – dictionary with at least the following key:value pairs: url, headers, params

Returns

dictionary of request data

pycm.utilities.TTLwait(func)¶

Utility waiting function for the credentials.PeriodicUpdate method.

Parameters

func – function PeriodicUpdate from the credentials.py module

Returns

credentials.PeriodicUpdate method instantiation
